medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing epigastric pain shortly after a ureteral stent removal procedure earlier in the day. The pain is constant and radiates to the back. The patient endorses nausea but denies vomiting initially, and there has been no fever or chills. On the floor, the patient reported being nauseous and vomiting earlier, which improved with medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes bladder cancer with recent surgical intervention, tobacco dependence, vocal cord nodules, colonic polyp, and Helicobacter pylori infection.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with breast cancer at age unspecified; maternal grandmother had ovarian cancer at her late unspecified; two maternal aunts had breast cancer; maternal cousin had ovarian cancer.
